titleStmt.title: Humble proposals to the Parliament now assembled whereby the profession of the civil law may be used in certain cases to the great ease and benefit of the people : without looking back to Episcopacy or any thing that is abolished, or making any use of the Pope's law commonly called The Canon law or taking away any thing from the Common law, and in a perfect compliance with this present government.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E.C. for R. Royston,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
